prompt: In a family, A is married to B. C and D are children of A and B. E is married to C. F is child of C and E. How is F related to B?
explanation: F is C's child. C is B's child. So F is B's grandchild.

prompt: P has two children Q and R. Q is married to S. T is child of Q and S. How is T related to R?
explanation: T is Q's child. R is Q's sibling. So T is R's nephew/niece.

prompt: X and Y are married. Z is X's mother. W is Z's husband. How is W related to Y?
explanation: W is Z's husband = X's father. X is Y's spouse. So W is Y's father-in-law.

prompt: A, B, C are siblings. D is A's son. E is B's daughter. How are D and E related?
explanation: D's father A is sibling of E's mother B. So D and E are cousins.

prompt: M is father of N. O is mother of P. N and O are siblings. How is M related to P?
explanation: N and O are siblings. M is N's father. So M is O's father too. Wait: if N and O are siblings, M is their father. O is P's mother. So M is P's grandfather.

prompt: In a family of 6, A and B are married. C is son of A. D is daughter of B. E is brother of C. F is married to D. How many males are there?
explanation: Males: A (if father), C (son), E (brother of C), F (married to D, likely male) = 4. Check: A-B married, C is A's son, E is C's brother, D is B's daughter. Need more info about A's gender.

prompt: P is Q's mother. R is Q's sister. S is P's mother. How is S related to R?
explanation: S is P's mother. P is R's mother. So S is R's grandmother.

prompt: A-B married. They have C (son) and D (daughter). E-C married. F is E's son. How is F related to D?
explanation: F is C's child. D is C's sister. So F is D's nephew.

prompt: In a joint family: L-M married, their children N and O. N-P married, their child Q. How is Q related to O?
explanation: Q is N's child. O is N's sibling. Q is O's nephew/niece.

prompt: X is Y's father. Z is Y's brother. W is X's father. How is W related to Z?
explanation: W is X's father. X is Z's father (since Z is Y's brother). So W is Z's grandfather.

prompt: A has two sons B and C. B has one daughter D. C has one son E. How are D and E related?
explanation: D is B's daughter, E is C's son. B and C are brothers. D and E are cousins.

prompt: P, Q, R are generations. P is Q's father. Q is R's mother. S is R's sister. How is P related to S?
explanation: P is Q's father. Q is S's mother. So P is S's grandfather.

prompt: In family: A-B (married), C is their daughter, D is C's husband, E is D's mother. How is E related to A?
explanation: E is D's mother. D is married to C. E has no blood relation to A.

prompt: M-N married. O is their son. P-O married. Q is P's father. How is Q related to N?
explanation: Q is P's father. P is married to O (N's son). Q has no blood relation to N.

prompt: A family has X, Y, Z, W. X is Z's father. Y is Z's mother. W is Y's mother. How is W related to X?
explanation: W is Y's mother. Y is X's wife. So W is X's mother-in-law.
